file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-32-06-04 - VOR/NAV 3 UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL VOR/NAV 3 UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the VOR/NAV 3 Unit. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 34-32-06-000-801-A VOR/NAV 3 UNIT - REMOVAL ALL 34-32-06-400-801-A VOR/NAV 3 UNIT - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-32-06 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-32-06-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. VOR/NAV 3 UNIT - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the VOR/NAV 3 Unit. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SB145-32-0003 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 214 113CZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the VOR/ILS 3 circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) On aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-32-00036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-00036, install the safety pin of the NLG-door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-32-06 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Open access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Release the knurled clamp knobs (2) which attach the VOR/NAV 3 Unit (3). (2) Pull the VOR/NAV 3 Unit (3) by its handle, until it is disconnected from the electrical connector (1) attached to the mounting tray. (3) Remove the VOR/NAV 3 Unit (3) from the mounting tray. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-32-06 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL VOR/NAV 3 Unit - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONES 213 214 DET. A 3. VOR/NAV 3 UNIT 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR DET. B 2. CLAMP KNOB (2) 145AMM340443.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-32-06 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-32-06-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. VOR/NAV 3 UNIT - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the VOR/NAV 3 Unit. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL AMM TASK 34-32-00-700-801-A/500 VOR/ILS SYSTEM OPERATIONAL TEST SB145-32-0003 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 214 113CZ Forward electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: WHEN YOU PUT THE UNIT ON THE MOUNTING TRAY, DO NOT FORCE FIT. IF MATING IS DIFFICULT, REMOVE THE UNIT AND MAKE SURE THAT THE CONNECTOR PINS ARE NOT BENT OR OUT OF ALIGNMENT. ALSO, VISUALLY EXAMINE THE ALIGNMENT OF THE RECEPTACLE ON THE MOUNTING TRAY. (1) Put the VOR/NAV 3 Unit (3) on the mounting tray. Move the unit rearward until its connectors are fully engaged with the mating connectors (1) of the mounting tray. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-32-06 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Tighten the knurled nuts (2) which attach the VOR/NAV 3 Unit (3) to the mounting tray. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close access door 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, close the VOR/ILS 3 circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (3) On aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-00036, remove the safety pin of the NLG-door solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (4) Do the VOR/ILS System Operational Test ( AMM TASK 34-32-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-32-06 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
